availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Daniel Carmichael Wickliffe (Lexington, Kentucky, attorney, editor and secretary of state)

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, attorney, editor and secretary of state. Lexington native. Married to Virginia Cooper Wickliffe on November 25, 1844. Graduate of Transylvania University in 1827. Admitted to the bar and began practicing in Winchester, Kentucky. Editor and proprietor of the Observer and Reporter in Lexington, Kentucky, from 1838 to 1865. Member of the Whig Party. Owned seven enslaved persons in 1860. Secretary of State for the Commonwealth of Kentucky, under Governor James F. Robinson, from 1862 to 1863.

ab.bibl:
